utterances.text: South Park took a very strong
stance on immigration when they made their episode about it
I personally grew up less than six miles from the Arizona Mexico border
and I really appreciate the majority of the messages in this episode
at the very beginning of the episode
we see a time portal open and someone from the future escape
then see that the boys have started a snow shuffling company
they first ask for a large amount of money
and then the homeowner talks them down to just a couple dollars
so they excitedly go out and start shuffling
and then we see that in typical fashion
Cartman acts as a CEO girl
where he does none of the work but takes his fair share or more of the money
in a government facility
they have the man from the future
and they find out that in the future
the economy is so bad that there's virtually no jobs
so he had to come back to the past
and he was hoping to put money into a bank account
and so it would accumulate interest
and he said that over time
the money would accumulate to become billions of dollars
but in the future that's only worth hundreds of dollars
but it would at least feed his family for a little while
and then they explain that there's no going back through this time portal
it's only one way
because a lot of people missed the deeper meaning from my last video
when I did this
the people from the future are representative of immigrants coming from Mexico
this whole thing is a metaphor
they then start to see that other people from the future came back
and they find out that it worked
that this man in our time was able to put money into the bank account
and people from the future saw that it did pay off
so then they start coming back
originally when Stan hears about this on the news
he's really excited there's people from the future
he wants to ask them questions and get to know them
though the boys go back to do the snow shoveling rounds
and the owner tells them
unfortunately
they've hired somebody else
they found a worker who will do all of the work that the four boys did
but they'll do it for a quarter
they ask who would take it
so little money
it's not even worth it
and then they look down the street
and they can see that every single house
has hired these immigrants from the future
for the cheap labor
and the boys are absolutely destroyed
because overnight their business doesn't exist
then see even more people coming from the future
and they're bringing their families
now they have a city council meeting
and they start talking about how people are losing their jobs
to these people from the future
because they will work for so little money that employers are firing everybody
and taking this cheaper labor
but instead of everyone getting mad at the employers for exploiting this labor
and exploiting these people from the future
they instead get mad at the people coming from the future who just need to eat
and they start blaming all of them losing their jobs and their problems
on these people from the future
and it becomes them saying they took our jobs
and slowly this conversation just devolves into that term they took our jobs
so Stan stands up cause he's there with the boys and he says yeah
that happened to us too
we have this business
and now all of these people come in and they're charging so little
we really don't have a business anymore
and everyone just looks at them like they're crazy
then they realize that they have to use this vernacular
this cult speak of they took our jobs
to get the validation for what they're going through
so Stan yells they took our jobs
then suddenly everyone rallies around them
and we see this slow indoctrination
where the boys have to start adopting this group thing
and their terms and their slurs
so he goes home and when he gets home
his parents have hired a worker from the future
and his dad boasts about how he only has to pay her 10 cents an hour
Stan gets angry and he
because he's been hanging out with all of these radical people
he uses this new slur called Gubak
because when people come back from the future they have ectoplasm burns on them
his parents immediately start yelling at him
and telling him that he's being bigoted for using that term
but the whole time
they're failing to see the irony of
while they're trying to protect this person from slurs
they're abusing her labour
because just because you can pay somebody a minimum amount
it doesn't mean that you should
but we see the hypocrisy of his parents addressing the bigotry of the situation
but failing to see that they're also part of the problem
I again exploiting this labour
we then see a debate on television and we have the pissed off wait
trash redneck conservative
and at this point this kind of cult thinking has devolved so much
all they're really saying now is they took our jobs
there's no more substance to it than that
it's just this kind of Perodit bigoted saying
again ignores the fact that the fault in all of this lies with the employers
and those who are willing to exploit the labor
not those who are desperate and need to feed themselves and their families
and this person failing to see that he's worried about feeding his family
and that's all the people from the future are worried about as well
the person he is debating against is aging hippie Liberal d bag
and again he completely ignores the problems that bring people there
and he tries to deflect about the labor abuse
while he does make some relevant points
about people coming just for a better life
he's really using those as a deflection tactic
so that he can have the moral high ground
and then it looks like he's the good guy
while he and others are still exploiting this labour
and all the redneck can say in responses they took our jobs
and this gets the crowd really riled up
we then go into school
and we see that they're now teaching in our modern day English
as well as the future language
kids get angry about this
and say that they don't want to learn the language of this future race
ignore that these people from the future are their lineage
they're related
and ignoring the fact that our country went and purged
all of the native languages
and made people learn English
cause the boys have become the supremacist
and part of that is thinking that what you're doing is superior
and not allowing other people to practice their customs
religions as well as their native languages
and then the aging Liberal hippie d bag comes in and again
makes a relevant point
but doesn't do anything to help
and it's again a deflection tactic
so that he can look like he's on the moral high ground
while not actually really helping anybody
and the whole time Mister Garrison is just teaching them perverse things
and this is ignored because they're so
focused on the idea of standardization in school
the conservative crowd gets back together
and they're all trying to figure out
how to stop the future people from coming back
so one guy recommends that they accelerate global warming
so that there's no future people to come back
cause they destroyed the world
but they don't believe in global warming
so that doesn't go anywhere
the boys end up going to a restaurant and they try to order
but they see that everyone working there
has now been replaced by people from the future
basically everywhere in town is being run by people from the future
cause everyone was so happy to expay them
next to nothing now that they're radicalized
Stan gets angry because the guy taking his order can't understand him
so he starts yelling slurs
and his parents are right behind him coincidentally
and they're quick to yell at him
but they're still gonna go to an establishment that exploits people's labor
their next meeting
the conservatives
somebody in the crowd recommends
what if we all just get into a big pile
and start getting a little fresh with each other
and then there's no babies made
and there's no future to be had if they get everybody
and they all immediately like this idea
so all of this conservative crowd
they march down to these kind of ghettos
that have been created for these future people
and all the dudes start growing out real hard
in the pile though
that no children will be born in the future
so this whole time Randy has been very supportive of this whole thing
until his job is replaced by somebody from the future who's also a geologist
and when Randy sees his employer
start to manipulate and use this person from the future
paying him just a mere fraction of what he should be paying a person
Randy becomes the head of this bigoted group
and Randy's trying to convince people to come and join their cause
then they ask Stan what he thinks
and he says well
instead of doing this
what if we make the future so great
that people never wanted to even come back in time in the first place
and we see a montage of them doing that
they start recycling
they go help people in other countries
they even start doing local improvement projects
they start going to green energy
they start trying out things like electric vehicles
and they go and try to help the vulnerable people in the society
and as they do all of this
the people from the future start to disappear
because the future was now so good
that they never even came back in the first place
there was no need to
and as everyone sees this
it encourages them even more
they put up solar panels and they start planting
but then they realise that it's too much work
and they would rather just go back to the pile
and it's true
if we want to help with immigration issues
what we need to do is go make these places better
our country has destabilized so many other countries
and making a better world for other people will make a better world for you
as well we all have the same future on the same planet
but some people are so selfish and bigoted they'd rather go to the pile
so if you blame illegal immigrants
instead of the people who are exploiting them and causing this whole cycle
then South Park says you'd be in the pile
